2.9 CITY INFRASTRUCTURE
2.9.1 Transport and Connectivity

The city of Chennai has a total road network of 2780 Kilometres in a predominantly
radial and ring pattern. The prime radial network of the city comprises Anna Salai
(NH45); Periyar EVR Salai (NH4); Chennai - Kolkotta Salai (NH5) and Chennai-
Thiruvallur Salai (NH205) (CMDA, 2008). The Southern Railways with three major
lines, i.e., Chennai Beach - Tambaram; Chennai Central - Thiruvallur and Chennai
Central - Gummidipoondi (CMDA, 2008). The Chennai International Airport
facilitates air connectivity in the city while the Port of Chennai, the third oldest
port, is a major cargo port and has been operational since 1881.
